intro: Thaspium aureum var. atropurpureum, commonly known as the purple-leafed thaspium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are often tinged with purple or reddish hues, especially on the underside, giving it a striking visual appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady areas.
